p: These studies suggest that in this disease, a suppression of the adaptive immune system along with hyper activation of the innate immune system causes a disease phenomenon that is similar to MAS/hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH). Comparing the laboratory features, hyperferritinemia and high lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) levels are common in both COVID-19 patients and patients with primary HLH. On the other hand, low fibrinogen and cytopenias due to bone marrow hemophagocytosis is not commonly found in COVID-19 patients [ 28]. It is likely that the pathophysiology of COVID-19 overlaps with low-grade HLH, and further studies addressing this aspect will be important to evaluate the role of immunosuppression and HLH type therapy in these patients.
